verses.roman:
jagannāthe deha' taila,--dīpa yena jvale
tāra pariśrama haiba parama-saphale"

synonyms: jagannāthe—unto Lord Jagannātha; deha'-deliver; taila—oil; dīpa—lamps; yena—so; jvale—burn; tāra pariśrama—his labor; haiba—will become; parama-saphale—completely successful.
translation: "Deliver this oil to the temple of Jagannātha, where it may be burned in the lamps. In this way, Jagadānanda's labor to manufacture the oil will be perfectly successful."
